business.headline: Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariff: India at 27%, but where does Pakistan stand?Asian nations have been the hardest hit by Trump's latest tariff move. The new duties aim to cut the US trade deficit and change global supply chains.
Sensex, Nifty snap 2-day winning streak as D-Street sees limited tariff impactThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 322.08 points to close at 76,295.36, while the NSE Nifty50 shed 82.25 points to end at 23,250.10.
Explained: How Trump's administration calculated reciprocal tariffsIn a statement released on Wednesday night, the United States Trade Representative (USTR) explained how the tariffs were determined.

Byju Raveendran alleges conspiracy caught on video amid legal woesThe video he shared is one minute and 44 seconds long and appears to be a screen recording of a virtual meeting involving Byju's shareholders and their lawyers.

Trump's tariff list: Here's why Asian countries took the biggest hitTrump tariff: Besides China, which now faces a total tariff of 54%, Vietnam has been hit with 46%, Thailand with 37%, South Korea with 25%, and India with 27%.

Trump's tariff order: India gets key exemptions on several critical mineralsTrump's new tariff order exempts India on copper, lumber, and critical minerals. The order imposes a 26% lower tariff on India compared to China, but experts question the calculation methods. Former diplomat Ashok Sajjanar criticises the non-transparent system and highlights the impact on strategic partnerships in the Indo-Pacific region.

Mixed bag, not a setback: India's first response to Trump's tariffThe Commerce Ministry of India is analysing the impact of the 27% tariff imposed by the US. The ministry states it's a mixed bag and not a setback. Exemptions are expected in sectors like pharmaceuticals, semiconductors, and critical minerals. The tariff ranges from 10% to 27% across various sectors. India aims to sign a Bilateral Trade Agreement with the US by fall this year.

Sun Pharma, Gland, Cipla, Dr Reddy's: Why pharma stocks are rising todayShares of Sun Pharma, Dr Reddy's Laboratories, Gland Pharma, and Cipla rose sharply during early trade, defying the weak trend visible on the broader markets.
Trump tariffs roil Dalal Street: Sensex, Nifty fall as IT stocks worst hitThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 344.27 points to 76,273.17, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 80.60 points to 23,251.75 as of 9:31 am.

Why Russia, Canada and these countries were not part of Trump's tariff hit listThe exclusion has raised eyebrows, especially as major trade partners like India (27%), the European Union (20%), and Vietnam (46%) have been slapped with hefty duties. So, why were these countries spared?

Mixed bag, not setback: Government official on Trump's tariffs on IndiaThe new tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump include a universal 10% duty on all imports into the US starting from April 5, with an additional 16% to be applied from April 10.

Stock market opening on April 3: Will Sensex, Nifty fall after Trump tariff?The stock market extended its gains for the second consecutive session in its last session. The Sensex surged 592.93 points to close at 76,617.44, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 166.65 points to end at 23,332.35.

entertainment.headline: SRK, Sunny Deol and Juhi Chawla's Darr to re-release in theatres on April 4Darr, the iconic Shah Rukh Khan film, is set to re-release in theatres on April 4.

Being called 'slave' is bigger insult: Akshay on 'F*** you' line in Kesari 2Akshay Kumar addressed the media at the trailer launch of 'Kesari 2', and commented on his character using a cuss word in the film. Watch the video inside.

Panchayat makers announce Season 4 release date on show's 5th anniversaryThe much-loved TVF series Panchayat celebrates its 5th anniversary with the announcement of Season 4, set to release in July, 2025. Prime Video marked the occasion by sharing a promotional video starring Jitendra Kumar and Jia Manek.

Bhuvan Bam, Rohit Saraf roped for Nikkhil Advani's web show on Rash Behari BoseNikkhil Advani is set to create a historical drama based on India's freedom journey, focusing on revolutionary Rash Behari Bose and Sachindra Nath Sanyal. Social media star Bhuvan Bam will play Bose, with Rohit Saraf and Pratibha Ranta playing pivotal roles.

Salman Khan's Sikandar leaked version contains uncut scenes, missing shots: ReportA leaked version of Salman Khan's recent film Sikandar surfaced online, causing concern among filmmakers and fans. The leak included uncut scenes and missing shots, which did not make it to the final shot.

Actor Nikhila Vimal trolled for performing with Dileep, accused in assault caseTamil-Malayalam actor Nikhila Vimal was called out by a section of fans after she shared the stage with actor Dileep, who is one of the accused in the 2017 Malayalam actor assault case. They performed at an event in Qatar recently.

Kesari 2 trailer: Akshay Kumar, R Madhavan clash in tale of justice, resistanceThe trailer of Kesari Chapter 2 has been released, offering a glimpse into the legal battle led by C Sankaran Nair post-Jallianwala Bagh massacre. The film features Akshay Kumar, Ananya Panday, and R Madhavan in pivotal roles.

People's real faces come out: Ranveer Allahbadia on Latent row in new podcastYouTuber and podcaster Ranveer Allahbadia addressed the 'India's Got Latent' row in his new podcast with a Buddhist monk. He talked about the controversial phase in his life, and mentioned the 'real faces' of people.

Vir Das announces memoir The Outsider: For fellow wanderers and utter idiotsVir Das announced his memoir The Outsider, sharing his journey across continents and the many worlds he's navigated. The book explores identity, comedy, and embracing the outsider experience.

Chhorii 2 trailer: Nushrratt to fight evil daasi Soha Ali Khan for her daughterChhorii 2, the sequel to the 2021 horror film, delves deeper into supernatural horror as Sakshi battles malevolent forces to protect her daughter in a world filled with haunting rituals. The trailer of the film is now out.

Kareena Kapoor, KJo react to viral video of her asking for 'chai without sugar'In a video that is going viral on Instagram, Kareena Kapoor is seen asking if she could get a cup of tea at an event. The video got a reaction from her friend Karan Johar, and a further quirky reaction by Bebo herself.

Ghum Hai... actor Param Singh supports finite shows: But they have not workedThe Indian television industry grapples with maintaining show quality over time, leading to a debate on the viability of finite shows. Actor Param Singh, in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, discussed the challenges and potential benefits of adopting finite formats.

Ali Fazal pays tribute to Val Kilmer: You were the 1st big-ticket compliment I gotActor Ali Fazal has shared a heartfelt tribute to Val Kilmer, reflecting on the late actor's influence on his career. Fazal recalled a significant compliment from Kilmer, highlighting the Hollywood legend's impact on his journey.

Aditi Rao Hydari says there was a 'drought' of work after Heeramandi's successAditi Rao Hydari revealed she struggled for work despite Heeramandi's success. She joked with Farah Khan about her career "drought" and spoke about her marriage to Siddharth.

Animal to Sikandar: Is Rashmika Mandanna being typecast as the submissive wife?It's tiresome to see that when Rashmika Mandanna travels to Bollywood, the roles she is given simply stereotype her as this ideal Indian wife, an idea that's seeped so deeply into our minds that women have been denied their individual identities for centuries. Will she break free?

Santosh review: Shahana Goswami excels in bold portrayal of India's broken systemSantosh movie review: Directed by Sandhya Suri, the film is a crime drama about a widow who dons the khaki after the death of her husband. It was UK's entry for Best International Feature Film at the 97th Academy Awards. The film's India release is blocked after censor board demanded extensive cuts.

Jasmine Bhasin, Aly Goni to marry in 2025? Actor Krishna Mukherjee answersActor Krishna Mukherjee recently confirmed about friends Aly Goni and Jasmine Bhasin. She shared that the two might get married in 2025.

Street Fighter star Jean-Claude Van Damme charged for ties to trafficked womenActor Jean-Claude Van Damme faces criminal charges in Romania over alleged links to a human trafficking case. Prosecutors claim he knowingly engaged with trafficked women at an event in Cannes.

Ridhi Dogra defends working with Fawad Khan in old video: We don't see nationalityActor Ridhi Dogra recently defended starring alongside Fawad Khan in Abir Gulal. In an old viral video, the actor claimed she checked all legal aspects before signing the film.

general news.headline: Not all are guilty: Mamata Banerjee on top court's ruling against 25,000 teachersMamata Banerjee questioned the blanket dismissal of nearly 25,000 teachers in Bengal, asserting that not all appointees were guilty of wrongdoing.

Carefully examining implications, in talks with US: India on Trump's tariffsThe statement by the Finance Ministry further revealed that discussions are underway between Indian and US trade teams to finalise a mutually beneficial, multi-sectoral Bilateral Trade Agreement.

Waqf Bill faces Rajya Sabha test, Kiren Rijiju says all properties for Muslims onlyThe Waqf (Amendment) Bill was tabled in the Rajya Sabha on Thursday, a day after it cleared the Lok Sabha after a 12-hour debate.

What if Trump's reciprocal tariff gambit fails, US has a fall guy readyUS President Donald Trump announced reciprocal tariffs on over 180 countries, including India. The additional tariffs will make imports to the US costlier. What if the entire tariff move backfires? Trump's inner circle has lined up a fall guy. And that is Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick. This is why Lutnick suits this purpose best.

It happens only in Kerala: BJP's surprise stance on Empuraan rowUnlike its usual hardline stance on rows involving right-wing sentiments or the 2002 Gujarat riots, the BJP in Kerala has taken a surprisingly measured stance in the L2: Empuraan row. This is what makes Kerala different and why the BJP is taking an unusual approach.

Live: Sanjay Singh attacks Waqf bill, says BJP trying to attack minorities one by oneWaqf Bill In Rajya Sabha Live Updates: The Waqf (Amendment) Bill has been tabled in Rajya Sabha, a day after it was passed in Lok Sabha following a 12-hour marathon debate. The Bill was passed after all amendments moved by the opposition members were rejected by voice votes. It was passed after division of votes -- 288 in favour and 232 against. Follow indiatoday.in for more updates.

Jhukunga nahin: Mallikarjun Kharge's Pushpa-esque counter after BJP's Waqf chargeMallikarjun Kharge's cinematic retort came as he hit back at Anurag Thakur, who accused him of grabbing Waqf land during a discussion on the Waqf bill in the Lok Sabha a day earlier.

Bihar woman dragged, raped near Bengaluru railway station as man restrains cousinA woman travelling from Kerala to Bihar was sexually assaulted near KR Puram railway station in Bengaluru while her cousin was restrained by a second attacker. Both suspects have been arrested.

Passengers panic as 40-foot waves slam cruise ship in Drake Passage. Terrifying videoThe video showed the 342-foot ship struggling against the relentless waves, a common occurrence in the Drake Passage due to the convergence of the Atlantic, Pacific, and Southern Oceans.

University of Bath School of Management: A Pathway to Global Career SuccessBath's School of Management blends top academics, hands-on learning, and career support to help students secure jobs at leading global companies.

Supreme Court halts tree razing near Hyderabad university, raps government actionSupreme Court on Wednesday took serious note of large-scale tree felling in the Kancha Gachibowli forest area of Telangana and directed the state government to immediately halt further deforestation.

S Jaishankar's 'cherry-picking' jab at Bangladesh's Northeast 'landlocked' claimS Jaishankar rebuked Bangladesh's Muhammad Yunus for calling India's Northeast 'landlocked', asserting New Delhi's regional connectivity role.

What Donald Trump's 27% reciprocal tariff means for IndiaThe 27% reciprocal tariff imposed by US President Donald Trump is a big blow to India's exports, affecting multiple industries. Here's what it means for the Indian economy and also a look at the key sectors at risk.

Panchayat makers announce Season 4 release date on show's 5th anniversaryThe much-loved TVF series Panchayat celebrates its 5th anniversary with the announcement of Season 4, set to release in July, 2025. Prime Video marked the occasion by sharing a promotional video starring Jitendra Kumar and Jia Manek.
Uddhav Thackeray's 'Jinnah' jab at BJP over Waqf bill and a dare on party flagUddhav Thackeray dared his former ally, the BJP, to remove the green colour from its party flag if it 'disliked Muslims'.

Byju Raveendran alleges conspiracy caught on video amid legal woesThe video he shared is one minute and 44 seconds long and appears to be a screen recording of a virtual meeting involving Byju's shareholders and their lawyers.

How Shivaji Maharaj expanded into South, defeated the Portuguese, and built a navyShivaji Maharaj not only battled the Mughals but also opposed strong regional powers that ruled southern India and dominated sea trade. His attacks on the Portuguese limited them to the western coast, and his wars with the Bijapur Sultanate weakened their grip. Through tireless battles, he established the Maratha empire, capturing many strategic forts himself.

Being called 'slave' is bigger insult: Akshay on 'F*** you' line in Kesari 2Akshay Kumar addressed the media at the trailer launch of 'Kesari 2', and commented on his character using a cuss word in the film. Watch the video inside.

Rahul Gandhi rakes up tariffs, China border row in Lok Sabha, gets BJP rebuttalLeader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi, speaking in the Lok Sabha, said bowing its head before foreigners was in the BJP's history and culture.

Chief Justice, Supreme Court judges to declare assets to public amid cash rowIn a bid for greater transparency, all 30 Supreme Court judges will publicly disclose their assets on the court's website. The decision, made at a full court meeting on April 1, also extends to future judges.

Karnataka BJP chief, Yediyurappa among leaders detained during price hike protestKarnataka BJP state chief BY Vijayendra, other leaders detained at Benglauru Freedom Park during their protest against price hike in state.

sports.headline: Head on his love-hate relationship with Indian fans: Doesn't spur me on anymoreStar Australia batter Travis Head recently opened on his love-hate relationship with the Indian fans after giving them several heart breaks with his performances over the last two years.

Mohammed Siraj was hurt after Champions Trophy snub, we saw that fire: SehwagFormer India opener Virender Sehwag said that Gujarat Titans' seamer Mohammed Siraj was hurt after not being picked in India's ICC Champions Trophy 2025 squad and the fire was visible during his spell against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB).

IPL 2025: AI predicts winner of KKR vs SRH clashIPL 2025: As Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) and Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) prepare to lock horns in Match 14 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025), we asked AI to predict the winner of the highly anticipated clash and got some interesting answers.

IPL 2025: MI star Suryakumar Yadav visits Ayodhya temple with wife DevishaSuryakumar Yadav visited the divine Ram Mandir in Ayodhya ahead of MI's clash with LSG, seeking blessings after his blistering knock against KKR at the iconic Wankhede stadium.

Sai Kishore's tactical preparation puts him ahead of other bowlers: Sai SudharsanGujarat Titans' Sai Sudharsan praised R Sai Kishore's pre-match preparation, calling it a major reason behind his success in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) so far. The left-arm spinner is the highest wicket-taker for Gujarat so far with six wickets from three matches.

Up and down performances happen when you play so aggressively: SRH Assistant CoachSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) assistant coach Ryan Cook has said that the team is bound to have mixed performances with their all-out aggressive approach. However, they will continue to bat the same way and will look to put the bowlers under pressure

SRH Assistant coach backs Mohammed Shami to find his form back vs KKR in KolkataSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) assistant coach Ryan Cook has backed their ace pacer Mohammed Shami to find his form back in the upcoming fixture against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) at Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

KKR vs SRH: When Kolkata bowlers spelt doom for Hyderabad in 2024 finalKKR and SRH are set to renew their rivalry in IPL 2025 at Eden Gardens, with Kolkata aiming to repeat their 2024 final triumph, while Hyderabad seeks revenge. Both teams need momentum after a shaky start to the season.

KKR vs SRH, pitch, weather report IPL 2025: High-scoring thriller in Kolkata?Eden Gardens gears up for a high-octane clash as defending champions KKR take on arch-rivals SRH, aiming to avenge last season's IPL final defeat. Expect a run-fest on the spin-friendly pitch under humid Kolkata skies.

KKR vs SRH Match Preview, IPL 2025: Kolkata take on hard-hitting Hyderabad at homeIPL 2025, Kolkata Knight Riders vs Sunrisers Hyderabad Match Preview: Having won one match early in the season, both KKR and SRH have failed to continue their winning momentum. Both teams will be eager to bounce back to winning ways as they take on each other in Match 15 of the season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
